segment.source: Enabling and Disabling Compatibility Fixes in Compatibility Administrator (Windows 10)
segment.target: Enabling and Disabling Compatibility Fixes in Compatibility Administrator (Windows 10)

segment.source: You can disable and enable individual compatibility fixes in your customized databases for testing and troubleshooting purposes.
segment.target: You can disable and enable individual compatibility fixes in your customized databases for testing and troubleshooting purposes.

segment.source: Enabling and Disabling Compatibility Fixes in Compatibility Administrator
segment.target: Enabling and Disabling Compatibility Fixes in Compatibility Administrator

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: You can disable and enable individual compatibility fixes in your customized databases for testing and troubleshooting purposes.
segment.target: You can disable and enable individual compatibility fixes in your customized databases for testing and troubleshooting purposes.

segment.source: Disabling Compatibility Fixes
segment.target: Disabling Compatibility Fixes

segment.source: Customized compatibility databases can become quite complex as you add your fixes for the multiple applications found in your organization.
segment.target: Customized compatibility databases can become quite complex as you add your fixes for the multiple applications found in your organization.

segment.source: Over time, you may find you need to disable a particular fix in your customized database.
segment.target: Over time, you may find you need to disable a particular fix in your customized database.

segment.source: For example, if a software vendor releases a fix for an issue addressed in one of your compatibility fixes, you must validate that the vendor's fix is correct and that it resolves your issue.
segment.target: For example, if a software vendor releases a fix for an issue addressed in one of your compatibility fixes, you must validate that the vendor's fix is correct and that it resolves your issue.

segment.source: To do this, you must temporarily disable the compatibility fix and then test your application.
segment.target: To do this, you must temporarily disable the compatibility fix and then test your application.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) installs a 32-bit and a 64-bit version of the Compatibility Administrator tool.
segment.target: Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) installs a 32-bit and a 64-bit version of the Compatibility Administrator tool.

segment.source: You must use the 32-bit version to work with custom databases for 32-bit applications and the 64-bit version to work with custom databases for 64-bit applications.
segment.target: You must use the 32-bit version to work with custom databases for 32-bit applications and the 64-bit version to work with custom databases for 64-bit applications.

segment.source: To disable a compatibility fix within a database
segment.target: To disable a compatibility fix within a database

segment.source: In the left-sde pane of Compatibility Administrator, expand the custom database that includes the compatibility fix that you want to disable, and then select the specific compatibility fix.
segment.target: In the left-sde pane of Compatibility Administrator, expand the custom database that includes the compatibility fix that you want to disable, and then select the specific compatibility fix.

segment.source: The compatibility fix details appear in the right-hand pane.
segment.target: The compatibility fix details appear in the right-hand pane.

segment.source: On the Database menu, click Disable Entry.
segment.target: On the Database menu, click Disable Entry.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: When you disable an entry, it will remain disabled even if you do not save the database file.
segment.target: When you disable an entry, it will remain disabled even if you do not save the database file.

segment.source: Enabling Compatibility Fixes
segment.target: Enabling Compatibility Fixes

segment.source: You can enable your disabled compatibility fixes at any time.
segment.target: You can enable your disabled compatibility fixes at any time.

segment.source: To enable a compatibility fix within a database
segment.target: To enable a compatibility fix within a database

segment.source: In the left-side pane of Compatibility Administrator, expand the custom database that includes the compatibility fix that you want to enable, and then select the specific compatibility fix.
segment.target: In the left-side pane of Compatibility Administrator, expand the custom database that includes the compatibility fix that you want to enable, and then select the specific compatibility fix.

segment.source: The compatibility fix details appear in the right-side pane.
segment.target: The compatibility fix details appear in the right-side pane.

segment.source: On the Database menu, click Enable Entry.
segment.target: On the Database menu, click Enable Entry.

segment.target: Related topics
